  • Revamping my personal site... again

     Feb 22, 2017

    My personal site didn't excite me so I decided to make some changes.

    Brendan suggested that I try to incorporate some of my values into the experience to better express who I am. The first words that come to mind are: curiosity, discovery and exploration. I have some ideas, but we'll see what I come up with.

  • A new goal: NYC Summer 2017

     Feb 21, 2017

    I'm setting a new goal for myself. By my birthday (June 9th), I want to be living and working in NYC.

    It's a great time to expand my horizons and my mom is finally in the homestrecth of recovering from her 4 foot surgeries.

    Here are some pics from a previous trip up to the city.

  • Roadblocks in deployment

     Feb 20, 2017

    Deploying tech products is simultaneously exciting and strenuous.

    We've merged our changes together and when we deployed them to staging there were multiple unforeseen errors. It's easy to forget how much testing is involved before launching a good product and I need to spend some more time working with the guys to iron out the bugs.

    We also closed a sprint today and outlined what we're working on next. Good things are coming!

  • Sunny day and preparing to launch

     Feb 19, 2017

    It was gorgeous out today! I went down to DC and walked around with Osebo.

    Jamba Juice smoothies

    Majestic dog

    Later we met up with Diego at his spot in Dupont and finalized everything we're including in tomorrow's deployment. Everything should be good to go on both web and mobile. I'm excited!

  • Mobile Registration/Landing Page

     Feb 18, 2017

    Media queries are almost done!

    I also worked a photography gig tonight which was fun but super loud. I might need to buy some earplugs.

  • More Mobile

     Feb 17, 2017

    Today was all about finishing more mobile media queries.

    The navigation now changes when the users scrolls past a certain height and the item overlays on mobile are swift with left/right arrow.

  • Mobile Media Queries V1

     Feb 16, 2017

    Responsive design is extremely important especially when mobile is often the first impression a user has with a new product.

    I started working on the media queries to make Stash's design mobile friendly.

    It is coming along nicely, but there is still a lot of work to be done.

  • Collections for your workflow

     Feb 15, 2017

    I had a great conversation today with an old friend about her problems collecting content at work. She's works in government and spends a lot of time researching politicians collecting articles, videos and more.

    She said that she's been using sticky notes to collect links and write notes, but that is has gotten extremely unorganized and overwhelming.

    The conclusion of the conversation was that she needed a solution that she equated to "Pinterest for the workplace." Once she said it, it was immeadiately evident that that was the niche we need to pursue.

    I suggested for her to try the beta and will be following up with her and her team to learn more about how we can improve their collection and collaboration.

  • Left/Right and Esc keys

     Feb 14, 2017

    Today I was able to get the key press events to work inside of the item overlays.

    They're really nice and the experience is really snappy thanks to React.

    We're finshing up a few last fixes and we should be launching to production within the week!
